description: The brutal pantheon of orcish deities, focused on conquest, strength, and survival in harsh conditions.

deities.name: Gruumsh One-Eye
deities.title: The One-Eyed God
deities.alabastria_context: Since The Bringing, Gruumsh has found new followers among the orc tribes scattered across Alabastria's harsh lands, particularly in the Blood Badlands and other unforgiving territories.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Gruumsh's followers arrived in Alabastria as scattered, desperate tribes. The One-Eyed God's influence was weak initially as orcs struggled to survive in unfamiliar lands.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As orc tribes began to organize and establish themselves in the Blood Badlands, Gruumsh's power grew. His followers became known for their brutal raids and conquests.
history_800_years.years_400_600: The orc tribes reached their peak of power, with Gruumsh's influence spreading across multiple continents. His followers established permanent settlements and began systematic conquests.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In the modern era, Gruumsh's followers have become more organized but also more integrated into Alabastrian society, though they maintain their warlike nature.

deities.name: Luthic
deities.title: The Cave Mother
deities.alabastria_context: Luthic's influence has been crucial for orc survival in Alabastria's harsh environments, particularly in the Blood Badlands where her followers have established hidden cave settlements.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Luthic's followers focused on survival and reproduction in the new world, establishing hidden cave settlements and ensuring the continuation of orc bloodlines.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As orc tribes grew, Luthic's influence expanded. Her followers became known for their healing abilities and their ability to make any cave habitable.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Luthic's temples became centers of orc civilization, providing healing, fertility blessings, and safe havens for orc families.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In modern times, Luthic's followers have adapted to Alabastrian society while maintaining their traditional cave-based communities and healing practices.

deities.name: Ilneval
deities.title: The War Chief
deities.alabastria_context: Ilneval's strategic wisdom has been invaluable for orc survival in Alabastria, helping them adapt their warfare tactics to the new world's challenges.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Ilneval's followers struggled to adapt their warfare tactics to Alabastria's diverse terrain and new enemies, leading to many early defeats.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As orc generals learned from their mistakes, Ilneval's influence grew. His followers began to develop new strategies suited to Alabastrian warfare.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Ilneval's temples became centers of military training, producing some of the most effective orc commanders in Alabastrian history.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In the modern era, Ilneval's followers have become respected military advisors, though they still maintain their aggressive tactics and strategic thinking.

deities.name: Bahgtru
deities.title: The Brute
deities.alabastria_context: Bahgtru's followers have become known for their incredible physical strength and unwavering loyalty, making them valuable allies and fearsome enemies in Alabastria.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Bahgtru's followers relied on brute strength to survive in the harsh new world, often serving as protectors for their tribes.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As orc tribes established themselves, Bahgtru's influence grew. His followers became known for their incredible physical prowess and loyalty.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Bahgtru's temples became centers of physical training, producing some of the strongest warriors in Alabastrian history.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In modern times, Bahgtru's followers have become respected mercenaries and bodyguards, valued for their strength and loyalty.

deities.name: Shargaas
deities.title: The Night Stalker
deities.alabastria_context: Shargaas's followers have found new opportunities in Alabastria's complex political landscape, serving as spies, assassins, and information brokers.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Shargaas's followers operated in the shadows, gathering information and eliminating threats to their tribes in the new world.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As orc tribes established themselves, Shargaas's influence grew. His followers became known for their stealth and cunning.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Shargaas's temples became centers of espionage and assassination, serving the needs of orc leaders and their allies.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In modern times, Shargaas's followers have become valuable assets in Alabastria's political intrigues, though they remain feared and distrusted.

description: The ancient draconic pantheon, representing the eternal struggle between metallic and chromatic dragons.

deities.name: Bahamut
deities.title: The Platinum Dragon
deities.alabastria_context: Bahamut's influence has been crucial for dragonborn integration into Alabastrian society, providing them with a moral compass and sense of purpose.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Bahamut's followers arrived in Alabastria as scattered dragonborn seeking a new home. The Platinum Dragon's influence helped them establish themselves as noble protectors.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As dragonborn communities grew, Bahamut's influence expanded. His followers became known for their justice and protection of the innocent.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Bahamut's temples became centers of justice and protection, serving as courts and sanctuaries for those in need.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In modern times, Bahamut's followers have become respected judges, paladins, and protectors throughout Alabastria.

deities.name: Tiamat
deities.title: The Chromatic Dragon
deities.alabastria_context: Tiamat's influence has been a constant threat in Alabastria, with her followers seeking power, wealth, and domination over others.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Tiamat's followers arrived in Alabastria as ambitious dragonborn seeking power and wealth in the new world.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As dragonborn communities established themselves, Tiamat's influence grew. Her followers became known for their greed and tyranny.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Tiamat's temples became centers of corruption and oppression, serving as bases for her followers' schemes.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In modern times, Tiamat's followers have become powerful merchants, corrupt officials, and tyrants, though they are constantly opposed by Bahamut's followers.

description: The primordial forces of nature, worshiped by genasi, tritons, and those who seek to understand the fundamental elements.

deities.name: Akadi
deities.title: The Queen of Air
deities.alabastria_context: Akadi's influence has been crucial for air genasi and sailors in Alabastria, helping them navigate the winds and adapt to change.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Akadi's followers arrived in Alabastria as scattered air genasi and sailors, seeking new horizons and opportunities.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As air genasi communities established themselves, Akadi's influence grew. Her followers became known for their adaptability and mobility.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Akadi's temples became centers of navigation and weather prediction, serving sailors and travelers throughout Alabastria.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In modern times, Akadi's followers have become respected navigators, messengers, and agents of change.

deities.name: Grumbar
deities.title: The Earth Lord
deities.alabastria_context: Grumbar's influence has been essential for earth genasi and miners in Alabastria, helping them work with the land and extract its resources.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Grumbar's followers arrived in Alabastria as earth genasi and miners, seeking to work with the land and extract its resources.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As earth genasi communities established themselves, Grumbar's influence grew. His followers became known for their strength and endurance.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Grumbar's temples became centers of mining and agriculture, serving as places of strength and stability.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In modern times, Grumbar's followers have become respected miners, farmers, and builders throughout Alabastria.

deities.name: Kossuth
deities.title: The Fire Lord
deities.alabastria_context: Kossuth's influence has been crucial for fire genasi and blacksmiths in Alabastria, providing them with the power to forge weapons and tools.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Kossuth's followers arrived in Alabastria as fire genasi and blacksmiths, seeking to forge new lives in the new world.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As fire genasi communities established themselves, Kossuth's influence grew. His followers became known for their forging skills and fiery temperaments.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Kossuth's temples became centers of forging and metalworking, producing some of the finest weapons and tools in Alabastria.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In modern times, Kossuth's followers have become respected blacksmiths, warriors, and agents of renewal.

deities.name: Istishia
deities.title: The Water Lord
deities.alabastria_context: Istishia's influence has been essential for water genasi and fishermen in Alabastria, helping them work with rivers and heal the sick.

history_800_years.years_0_200: Istishia's followers arrived in Alabastria as water genasi and fishermen, seeking to work with the rivers and heal the sick.
history_800_years.years_200_400: As water genasi communities established themselves, Istishia's influence grew. His followers became known for their adaptability and healing abilities.
history_800_years.years_400_600: Istishia's temples became centers of healing and water management, serving as places of peace and renewal.
history_800_years.years_600_800: In modern times, Istishia's followers have become respected healers, fishermen, and agents of adaptability.
